page.title: 13Potteric Carr Nature Reserve
page.content: Potteric Carr{Nature Reserve}is situated in a shallow basin of land and consists mainly of peat and clay deposits. The Yorkshire Naturalists Trust took over Potteric Carr from B.R.in 1968 and despite threats from a proposed{motorway railway}development and its use for flood relief,it is now seen as an area of some importance. Potteric Carr consists of two areas of open water,reed fen,marsh ,birch and oak woodland,magnesium limestone sidings and large railway lines and waste ground. Large numbers of{water {birds}are attracted to the area for winter feeding,summer breeding and a haven in passage.Many species of duck together with migrants like field fare seek food and shelter in the winter. Later in the year,{summer migrants increase the already large bird population.
